evidence.source_document: Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Petitioners-Plaintiffs (“Petitioners”) are Venezuelan men in immigration custody at risk of imminent removal under the President’s Proclamation—signed in secret on March 14, 2025, and published the next day—invoking the Alien Enemies Act (“AEA”), a wartime measure that has been used only three times in our Nation’s history: the War of 1812, World War I and World War II.

extracted.value: Petitioners-Plaintiffs (“Petitioners”) are Venezuelan men in immigration custody at risk of imminent removal under the President’s Proclamation—signed in secret on March 14, 2025, and published the next day—invoking the Alien Enemies Act (“AEA”), a wartime measure that has been used only three times in our Nation’s history: the War of 1812, World War I and World War II.

evidence.source_document: Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On March 15, the government deported at least 137 noncitizens to a brutal prison in El Salvador, without any review of any aspect of the determination that they are alien enemies.

extracted.value: On March 15, the government deported at least 137 noncitizens to a brutal prison in El Salvador, without any review of any aspect of the determination that they are alien enemies.

evidence.source_document: Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Petitioners, along with others who may be detained across the country and may not even know about their designations as alien enemies, were temporarily protected from these summary removals pursuant to the court’s order in J.G.G. v. Trump, No. 1:25-cv-766-JEB (D.D.C.).

extracted.value: Petitioners, along with others who may be detained across the country and may not even know about their designations as alien enemies, were temporarily protected from these summary removals pursuant to the court’s order in J.G.G. v. Trump, No. 1:25-cv-766-JEB (D.D.C.).

evidence.source_document: Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Multiple judges have already held there is likely no authority for the government’s actions.

extracted.value: Multiple judges have already held there is likely no authority for the government’s actions.

evidence.source_document: Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Petitioner D.B.U. is a thirty-two-year-old Venezuelan national who is detained at the Denver Contract Detention Facility, and who, having been erroneously alleged to be a member of Tren de Aragua, is at imminent risk of removal under the Proclamation. In his immigration proceedings, D.B.U. intends to seek asylum... On January 26, 2025, D.B.U. was apprehended at a party he had been invited to by friends who were not Venezuelan.

extracted.value: Petitioner D.B.U. is a thirty-two-year-old Venezuelan national who is detained at the Denver Contract Detention Facility... On January 26, 2025, D.B.U. was apprehended at a party he had been invited to by friends who were not Venezuelan.

evidence.source_document: Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Petitioner R.M.M. is a twenty-five-year-old Venezuelan national who is detained at the Denver Contract Detention Facility, and who, having been labeled by ICE as a “known member” of Tren de Aragua, is at imminent risk of removal under the Proclamation. ... On March 1, 2025, he was arrested and detained at the Denver Contract Detention Facility.

extracted.value: Petitioner R.M.M. is a twenty-five-year-old Venezuelan national... On March 1, 2025, he was arrested and detained at the Denver Contract Detention Facility.

evidence.source_document: Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Proclamation characterizes Tren de Aragua as a hybrid criminal state.

extracted.value: The Proclamation characterizes Tren de Aragua as a hybrid criminal state.

evidence.source_document: Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Proclamation provides no means or process for individuals to contest that they are members of the TdA.

extracted.value: The Proclamation provides no means or process for individuals to contest that they are members of the TdA.

evidence.source_document: Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Proclamation denies meaningful procedural protections.

extracted.value: The Proclamation denies meaningful procedural protections.

evidence.source_document: Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Proclamation denies Petitioners meaningful procedural protections, including a 30-day notice.

extracted.value: The Proclamation denies Petitioners meaningful procedural protections, including a 30-day notice.
